page.title: 062158 CORNTON
page.content: {LANDSCAPE:}Primary land cover, approximately 75%,is mixed woodland. Secondary cover, about 20%,is rough grazing.It is marshy with a peaty soil and little surface water.Tertiary cover,3%,comprises two cultivated fields,one sown with grass and one ploughed.{INLAND WATER:}The N.Esk flows from S.W.to E. About 4ms.wide with fairly steep sides,it is crossed by several bridges including a Roman bridge.There is a weir and two man-made ponds,the Hurley Pond and the Low Pond which is used for curling and canoeing.{RESIDENTIAL:}There are five houses.One near the river is the gardener's house.The others are at Cornton.Only one of these is occupied by a local worker(a gamekeeper).{ {BUILDINGS:}There are the outer walls of an old castle in the S.E. section of the area.
